com.milk.uberchat.iface
Interface ChatChannelHolder

All Superinterfaces:
ChatEntity, ChatLocus, Commandable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ChatIdentity, ChatUser
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseChannelHolder, BaseIdentity, BaseUser
public interface ChatChannelHolder
extends ChatLocus

This interface is for ChatLocus objects that also have an associated list of channels. The two normal cases of this are ChatIdentity which knows about all the channels for the identity and ChatUser which knows what channels the user is on.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1998-1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.
See Also:
ChatIdentity, ChatUser

Method Detail

addListener

public void addListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Add a listener for this object. If the listener is in fact an ChannelHolderListener, then it gets immediately sent a channelCreated event for each channel the identity knows about.

Specified by:
addListener in interface ChatLocus
Parameters:
listener - the listener to add
See Also:
ChannelHolderEvent, ChannelHolderListener

getKnownChannel

public ChatChannel getKnownChannel(java.lang.String name)
Given a canonical name, return the known channel that corresponds to that name, or return null if there is no known channel with that name. No querying of the host should be done to satisfy this request.

Parameters:
name - the canonical channel name to look up
Returns:
null-ok; the corresponding channel, if any

getKnownChannelCount

public int getKnownChannelCount()
Return the number of currently-known channels for this object.

Returns:
the count of known channels

getKnownChannels

public ChatChannel[] getKnownChannels()
Return the list of currently-known channels for this object. That is, no querying of the host should be done to satisfy this request.

Returns:
the list (array, actually) of currently-known channels

updateChannels

public void updateChannels()
Ask for the list of channels for this object to be updated from the host. This may (and in fact should) return quickly, after which a series of channelAdded and channelRemoved events may be expected to be broadcast to the listeners of this object, as appropriate.
